intro: Oxytropis campestris var. dispar, commonly known as the yellow locoweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellow to reddish-purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is native to the western United States and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Oxytropis campestris var. dispar is a perennial shrub that can grow up to 1 meter tall, and it plays a role in stabilizing soil in arid environments.
